Every group is selected randomly. It is not easy to understand who is your friend and who is your foe. You can’t check if there is someone else at the same level. Dead character may turn out not to be dead at all. You need to look around and be attentive not to become next victim.

Every level of Citadel is based on famous thriller scenarios. To win the game, you usually need to reach the exit. However, it is not an easy task. If a prisoner doesn’t tackle the obstacle, he/she is returned to the previous level

Depending on the achievements, a player gets access to different masks that open new opportunities. By completing the most complicated achievements, a player can enter one of the confronting order: Legalists, Servants of Ancients, or Guardians of Memory.

The game doesn’t have a text chat, but it is offered to use a voice 3D chat instead. Then closer players are, then better they hear each other. It is also planned to add the support of popular virtual reality helmets (i.e. Oculus).

All these will allow players to get a new experience of team-play in virtual reality.

Source: The Game Website.

209109.description:
Wizards and Unicorns is a fast-paced card game about battling unicorns, wizards, unicornwizards, elves, and pegasus set in the city of Unicornopia. You dive into the role of one of them trying to gain control over the Stone of Sigma. In order to achieve this, you try to gather fans among the wizards in town.

In a match of Wizards and Unicorns, you battle with your foes for fan markers by playing showtime cards and hoping to keep them on stage. As the players take their turns, the draw pile will soon run empty. The game ends as soon as a player manages to get a certain number of fans or the draw pile runs empty.

The game consists of roughly 50 uniquely styled and funny cards, each featuring many different effects, offering you the possibility to play the game with many different strategies. The vast options of combining them and the growing intensity as the draw pile shrinks lead to many new and exciting situations.
209109.name: Wizards and Unicorns

209110.description:
From the publisher:

Watch the sun-parched skies in this thrilling Mummy’s Mask adventure! You and your allies are called to defend the city of Wati after a massive flying pyramid appears in the skies above it! To save the citizens of Osirion, you must venture deep into the monument vault in the far reaches of the Slave Trenches of Hakotep to discover a way to bring the Sky Pharoah’s tomb crashing down to earth! The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: The Slave Trenches of Hakotep Adventure Deck is a 110-card expansion that adds 5 new scenarios to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, and also includes new locations, villains, monsters, curses, traders, loot, and more.
209110.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Adventure Deck 5: The Slave Trenches of Hakotep

209111.description:
From the publisher:

Your Mummy's Mask adventure concludes in high-flying style! As you bring the sky pyramid down to the ground for the first time in 6,000 years, you must venture into four elemental crypts and defeat the mummy lord Hakotep's generals. Should you live through this experience, the Sky Pharaoh himself will stand against you. The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Pyramid of the Sky Pharaoh Adventure Deck is a 110-card expansion that adds 5 new scenarios to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, and also includes new locations, villains, monsters, curses, traders, loot, and more.
209111.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Adventure Deck 6: Pyramid of the Sky Pharaoh

209112.name: Diluvion
209112.description:
User Summary

A great flood ravaged the land, a thick layer of unbreakable ice covered the seas, forcing us to live in underwater cities, traversing the oceans in our steampunky contraptions.

209113.description:
House of Normandy is a "quad" centered on the dynastic struggles of William the Conqueror's extended family, and the second game in the SHIELDS & SWORDS II series. The earliest of the four battles collected herein saw two of William's sons duking it out. The other three battles are all drawn from the reign of Stephen of Blois, the Conqueror's grandson, and the long period of instability and intermittent civil war that has come to be called The Anarchy. During the twelfth century, armies tended to avoid giving battle to one another, and when it did come to blows, neither side exhibited much endurance; there's none of that "they fought from sunrise to sunset" stuff here. Nor was anyone involved particularly renown for any special military genius. As a result, the battles here are short, small, and uncomplicated affairs, ideal both for solitaire study, and for a quick game with a friend. That's not to say the battles are lacking in flavor, however, as each brings something unique to your table.

The Battle of Tinchebray (1106) gives each player Wings composed of both cavalry and foot soldiers, and arrayed in echelons. S & S vets know that horse and non-horse units don't support the other's attacks, which makes things tricky. The battle turns on the timely (or not) arrival of a hidden English Wing.

The Battle of the Standard (1138) is a matter of English quality versus Scots quantity. The English have a good defensive position, and are mostly arrayed into a single Wing (with all the pluses and minuses that come with it). Successive waves of Scots will usually be forced to attack the English piecemeal. The English have the advantage in the early game, but the longer the game runs, the more Scottish numerical superiority will rule the day. To recreate the spectacularly lopsided victory that the English enjoyed historically, the English player will have to seal the deal in the early going.

The Battle of Lincoln (1141) might be described as a game of "press your luck" for poor King Stephen. He has some good units, but as soon as one Wing defects, the others might follow, turning an even contest into a slaughter. His Angevin opponent must make good use of not only his horse, but also his Welsh infantry, which is fearsome but brittle.

The Battle of Wilton (1143) commences at dusk, and ends at nightfall. This means the battle has a time pressure element, quite unusual for the S&S system. Neither player knows exactly when the battle is going to end. Will the Blesevins break through the Angevin line, or will Stephen's retreat be covered by his gallant rearguard?

The SHIELDS & SWORDS II series builds on, and improves, the Shields & Swords series of games (We Happy Few, Stamford Bridge, A Hill Near Hastings, and Our Royal Bones), with a greater variety of unit types, revised suppression rules, and a new D8-based CRT. S&S II revolves around the activation of Wings using double-sided Command Markers, with a flexible scale and simple, easy-to-teach rules.
209113.name: House of Normandy

209114.name: Rising Sun over China
209114.description: Rising Sun over China( RSOC) simulates the Japanese invasion of China prior to World War II (1937-1941) on a table top map scaled at 50 miles per hex with division-level playing pieces and monthly game turns. The simple I-go-U-go game mechanics keep play fast and focused while additional rules evoke the feel of 1930s China. Two player game as written, but can be played solo like many wargames, as there is little hidden information. Game comes in Paper Wars #83.

209115.name: Loose Lips Sink Ships
209115.description:
The Journey Across the Sea

Publisher's blurb:

The ocean holds many dangers, a secret plot to be uncovered and an attack by undead pirates will need to be repelled in this short sea adventure.

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters. Distributed with a supporting file containing three pages of print-and-play components.

209116.name: Assault on the Good Temple of Rannance
209116.description:
From the introduction:

Recently, a large band of Hill Giants was reported in the area, but they have steered clear of the village [of Rannance]. None one is certain why they have done so, but none really care as long as they stay away from the village and not attack.

User summary:

For 4th - 7th level characters. This scenario typically is distributed as an ASCII text scenario and four BMP files (maps).

209117.name: The Last Resting Place
209117.description:
From the introduction:

The cleric wears a travel stained robe and has obviously traveled far in a hurry. He approaches the [characters] and bows before talking, his voice hoarse from the dust of the road. “Brothers, do you know where the elder of our house is? I have dire news.”

User summary:

For 7th - 9th level characters.

209118.name: The Fog: On Board Pearl's Peril
209118.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure doesn't have locations; instead [it has] days and nights. It starts on the 2nd morning out of Narvik. The party will have met all of the crew by now and talked with most, though [one], Iago, is less friendly than most. Each day [Iago will] ask what the [player characters] are doing and where they are doing it.

User summary:

For low-level characters. This is a minimalist adventure that occurs during a presumably unremarkable shipboard transit of an expected five or so days.

209119.name: Khazan City Chaos
209119.description:
(publisher blurb)

What adventures lie in wait in the City of Khazan?

The king has had some of his ancestral treasure stolen, but you know who has stolen it and where they can be found. But what will you do with the treasure?

Khazan City Chaos is a solo adventure for Tunnels and Trolls. It is for a level 1-2 character with no more than 70 adds.

209120.name: The King's Tomb
209120.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is set in Nithia one of the Emirates Of Ylaruam but it can be set in any Egyptian style campaign. The PCs are hired by Haroon, a sage from Cinsa-Men-Noo to investigate a possible ancient tomb reported to him by some caravan guides. A number of medium level undead occupy the tomb and protect its treasures.

User summary:

For mid-level characters. The adventure typically is distributed with a GIF image file (map).

209121.name: Tomb of the Overfiend
209121.description:
(publisher blurb)

Tomb of the Overfiend is a free one-page adventure for Weird West RPG. The adventure is also compatible with other "old school" type roleplaying games with a few small changes to some of the statistics for the encounters.

209122.name: The Reluctant Bride
209122.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs have been hired to escort a small caravan, which includes a daughter of a high ranking official, from Ylaruam City to Abbashan. The daughter, Seema, is to be married to a high ranking official in Abbashan. Seema however has other plans and runs away with her lover and hide in the lost city of Kabar.

User summary:

For mid-level characters. The adventure is easily adapted to any campaign setting featuring a large desert realm.

209123.name: Rescue From the Scarlet Mark
209123.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Tameronikas has a large sheltered harbour and is the capital of the province of Nicostenia in Ylaruam. It is a cosmopolitan city with a population of about four thousand. Trade is carried out with many other nations. Silk, velvet, satin, linen, brocade, fine cloth, porcelain, precious woods, lamps and paper are common imports. Exports include carpets, weapons, fine jewellery, perfumes, horses and precious metals. Another less savory trade is that in slaves. The emir knows it goes on and does what he can to stop it, but the profits are high.

User summary:

A difficult scenario for mid-level characters. The DOC version typically is distributed with six separate DOC files (detailed non-player characters) and a GIF file (map).

209124.name: Kabuki
209124.description:
A game based on mimicry for two to four teams of players.

In each team's turn, one of the team's players attempts to silently mimic a specific thing, with the goal of enabling their team partners to guess which thing it is before the timer runs out. The things to be mimicked fall in one of four categories, each one of which has an associated mask to be worn by the player that will attempt the mimicry: actions (mime mask); places (Indian mask); animals and things (tiger mask); and school (teacher mask).

Teams advance their tokens along the game board by rolling one die, as long as they keep succeeding in guessing the mimicked concept after each throw of the die.

The goal is to be the first team to reach the last space in the game board (number 36).

Game contents:
-Game board.
-Hourglass.
-4 masks.
-144 word cards.
-12 joker cards.
-4 team tokens.
-1 die.

209125.description:
Players attempt to buy famous video games for several contemporary consoles, and also the consoles themselves. Income is gained by other players renting games and consoles from them, and money is spent when they rent games and consoles from other players.

Gameplay
On their turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned game, they have the opportunity to buy it and add it to their collection. If a player owns all the games for a specific console, they may then buy consoles to rent with each game, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If they land on a game owned by another player, they must pay that player a rental price according to the value of the game and any consoles coming with it. There are other places on the board which cannot be bought, but instead require the player to: draw a "News" card and perform the action on the card; draw a "Question" card and answer a question about video games in order to win a prize; collect income; or fix a broken console (which can keep them from moving for as long as three turns).

Player elimination
If a player does not have enough money to pay for a debt, not even by selling all of their video games and consoles, they will be bankrupt and out of the game.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.

Background
This Monopoly-inspired game was gifted to readers of Spanish video game magazine Hobby Consolas with their numbers 54 and 55. Publication of the game was sponsored by Spanish video game retail chain Centro Mail.

Game contents:
-Game board.
-26 video game cards.
-26 console cards.
-20 News cards.
-31 Question cards.
-310 point notes.
-10 Centro Mail discount coupons.

(Additionally, two dice and one token per player are required to play the game.)
209125.name: El gran juego de Hobby Consolas

209126.name: Legends of the Deep Guild Standard Rule Set
209126.description:
(publisher blurb)

The Legends of the Deep Guild is a series of micro-gamebook adventures that have evolved from a short, two-page gamebook format developed as a part of the Chronicles of Arborell interactive gamebook series. Each of these legends is a solitaire role-playing adventure game, one that allows a player to take on the role of a Brother of the Deep Guild of Das Vallendor and complete a range of difficult missions into the ruins of Arborell. All you need is the Standard Rule Set available here, a pen, two six-sided dice, and a piece of paper to record the changing status of your character as you play. May Glory and Renown follow all who are successful.

209127.name: Beyond Your Dreams
209127.description:
From the introduction:

Beyond Your Dreams is a game of Lucid Dreaming. You take the role of a Dreamer. When you dream, you’re Lucid - you have control of your own actions, and you can even affect the world around you with your will. The catch is, your dreams aren’t your own, and that’s not necessarily a bad thing. Dreams are how your deepest secrets get out, and yours will bring your life crashing down around you, should anyone ever find out. Luckily, that shouldn’t happen as long you’re careful.

You’ll explore the Dreamscape and gain power you’ll never have in the ‘real world’. The confidence it brings can still help there, however. You’ll walk through the deepest parts of people, and find out what drives them, and learn more about yourself through the journey.

User summary:

During early development this game was titled The Lucid Project.

209128.name: Paradox Inversion Core
209128.description:
User summary:

Paradox Inversion Core presents a generic, universal system intended to support gaming in any genre or style. Characters are built from Attributes and Skills. Additionally, character Archetypes are used, and characters can gain experience and improve. The game uses a larger number of Attributes: Strength, Dexterity, Agility, Intelligence, Charisma, Alertness, Spirit, Endurance, and Offense. Characters also have a number of Derived Attributes, primarily dealing with combat ability. Attributes have numeric values ranging from zero to five, averaging two. An Attribute score reduced to zero typically has significant penalties.

209129.name: Paradox Inversion Character Sheet
209129.description:
User summary:

This one-page character sheet is updated for the most-recently-released version of the game and is intended to be used as a print-and-play component.

209130.name: Combat: Expanded
209130.description:
User summary:

Combat: Expanded is a set of optional rules for combat in the Paradox Inversion Roleplaying System. These rules are intended to add a bit of grit to your combat settings and give players more options in combat. This material is aimed at people who have some experience in RPGs, but is still fairly easy to digest.

209131.name: The White Skulls
209131.description:
User summary:

The White Skulls is a single campaign, designed to help new [game masters] get an idea of how stories work in tabletop roleplaying games. This story as written is able to be used with any RPG system you desire. The story is written for 2-5 people, and is intended to be completed in one session.

The story is broken down into seven major events, which happen in chronological order. For the most part, these don’t need to happen in rapid succession. Days can pass between events if you wish to prolong the story, as players could easily have other things to do. Some of these events have set outcomes but players are welcome and should be encouraged to take charge of their characters whenever they can.

209132.name: There's a Fan Fic for That...
rpg: There's a Fan Fic for That...
209132.description:
From the introduction:

There's a Fan Fic for That... is a game about creating live action “fan fiction” stories. Set in alternate universes and crossing multiple canons the stories can be funny, romantic, or even angsty. Part of the fun of the game should come from trying to remain “in character” even when Characters are put into strange or ridiculous situations. No prior knowledge of fan fiction is necessary to play this game. It's all about putting familiar characters into unusual and interesting situations.

rpg: keymaster: a short ritual of dramatic identity
209133.name: keymaster: a short ritual of dramatic identity
209133.description:
From the introduction:

keymaster is fundamentally a game about acting creatively on those moments when you’re in an inspiring place and want to do, become, or portray something just as awesome.

keymaster is designed to be playable as a spontaneous activity while going about life. it can also be arranged as an explicit social activity, especially with the advance prep extension.

play while hiking, traveling, strolling, waiting, vacationing, visiting a cool building. or, use the abstract key extension to play anywhere, like on a plane or bus, in a restaurant, or at home.

User summary:

The PDF document includes two URL references to online videos that serve as "inspiration".

209134.name: The Marble Sanctum
209134.description:
From the introduction:

Thousands of years ago, a powerful necromantic sect forged the Marble Sanctum from within the limestone bedrock of a remote tropical island. Using a magical artifact called the Tao Engine, they pressurized and heated the limestone in place to create a massive marbleized network of rooms and passages. It would become a fortress and center of magical research for the faction’s leading arch lich-mage. It would also become his eternal tomb in the last battle of the Azi-Schism.

209135.name: Hero Quest: Tower Conflict
209135.description:
User Summary

Simple Tower Defence game where you sent out a warrior, archer, mage, and axe-man based on timers. Combined with spells of fire, ice, healing, and bolt, you hope to defeat the enemy warriors and hit the castle enough times to win.

209136.name: Q.E.
209136.description:
Financial crisis has occurred. 16 'too big to fail' companies from 4 countries need bailing out. The central banks have unlimited financial resources, lots of money is going to be printed. But the central banks also face disaster - print too much money and the country they represent goes bust.

In Q.E. you play the role of a central bank. You will bid on different size companies to accumulate various levels of victory points. The amount you bid is unlimited (you are the central bank and you own the printing press!) After the initial 'open' bid by the lead player the other players bid in secret.

After the 16 companies have been 'bailed out' bonus victory point are awarded for company sets of nationalisation, monopolization and diversification.

Players markers on the scoring track will now reveal which player has the most victory points. But this is not the end. Players must now add up the amount of money they printed and the player who printed the most money loses all their victory points!

209137.name: Kes Leiab Esimesena?
209137.description:
The game consists of 300 image squares and a modular game board. The game board has 300 different items, which must be incorporated to find image squares. Image squares also have interesting additional functions, which make the game even more exciting. The game can be played in many different ways, both basic and advanced rules. Therefore, the game is suitable for different age groups - from tiny kids to adults.

Players pull the picture-tiles from the bag and must find the needed pictures from the board. First player gets the tile as a point. First player who finds the required number of pictures first is the winner.

209138.name: Shuffle: Twister
209138.description: Shuffle: Twister is a take on the traditional game of twister with a card based shuffle. In this version you start the game sitting in a circle on the floor with a single card between each player, color side up. Then players take turns drawing a card from the remaining cards in a deck that is placed in the middle of all the players. The card you draw will tell you to place the card on another player somewhere on their body and it may tell you to touch them with a head, hand, or foot. If you're given a card you must keep it in place and not let it fall even while you're placing cards on other people. If you do drop a card you lose a life, if you lose a second life you're out of the game. Last player in the game wins.

209139.name: Day D - Ice Age
209139.description:
User Summary

DLC expansion for Day D - Tower Rush.

Continue battling hordes of dinosaurs over 20 new levels.

209140.name: Day D - Time Mayhem
209140.description:
User Summary

DLC expansion for Day D - Tower Rush.

Fight more new, and strange, enemies over 20 more levels.

209142.name: A Scream in the Night
209142.description:
From the introduction:

Melvaunt is a city of merchants and metalsmiths. The docks are constantly filled with ships from Hillsfar, Mulmaster, and more distant ports. The northern coast of the Moonsea is an inhospitable place, and its people have a reputation for being rough and unfriendly.

But they don’t go around murdering one another in the streets.

At least, not usually. Was that a scream you just heard? Part One of The Chaos in Melvaunt.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

209143.name: A Cog in the Wheel
209143.description:
From the introduction:

With the identity of a murderer confirmed, heroes are needed to track it down to its home. As it turns out, it might be a longer journey than first imagined.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

209144.name: A Hole in the World
209144.description:
From the introduction:

Threats from outside Melvaunt and within push heroes to the brink as a terrified populace counts on the bravery of a few heroes to avert total disaster.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

209145.name: Mines of Barule
209145.description:
From the introduction:

The mountain isn't very big, but it is well known for its streaks of gold and silver as well as a rich iron mine. The mine was quickly exploited by people from the nearby towns that soon settled in the area around the mountain Barule where they founded a mining town called Kul Tiras.

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters. This scenario is distributed as three separate RTF files - the scenario itself, a "monsters" document, and a "table" (random encounters) document.

209146.description:
Fishery is an abstract strategy game in which 2 players place ships and cast nets, each trying to have the largest area in their fisheries.

MATERIALS

Gameboard (7×9 grid)

12 Ship pieces (6 white, 6 black)

60 Net pieces (sticks: 30 white, 30 black)

SETUP

The gameboard starts empty. Each player selects a color, and Black goes first. Players alternate turns during the game.

PLAY

Phase 1: Place Ships

On your turn, place 1 of your ships in an empty square space on the gameboard.

Once all 12 ships are on the gameboard, continue to the next phase.

Phase 2: Place Nets

On your turn, either place a net on one of the net spaces between the squares according to the rules below, or pass:

1. A fishery is an area completely surrounded by nets, including the pre-printed blue nets at the edge of the board.

2. Each fishery must contain at least one ship, but not necessarily your own ship.

3. Each fishery must use at least one of the pre-printed blue nets at the edge of the board as part of its border.

END OF THE GAME

If both players pass consecutively, the game is over.

SCORING

For each fishery, the player with more ships in it controls that fishery, and scores 1 fish for each square space in it, including the spaces with ships. If both players have the same number of ships in a fishery, neither player controls that fishery, and neither gets the fish.

The player with the most fish wins! In the event of a tie, the second player (White) wins.
209146.name: Fishery

209147.description:
Tallinn: The City Guard is a postcard expansion for Tallinn that consists of four tokens that need to be cut from the card.

The player (or players) who first builds a tower takes one of these tokens. Another player can take a token only if they have more towers than whoever currently holds a token, but if this happens, the previous token holder must return their token to the supply. At the end of the game, token holders receive 3 points for each other player who does not have a token.
209147.name: Tallinn: The City Guard

209148.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 11 - Mentalist)
209148.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week we have a new Advanced Class, the Mentalist!

209149.name: King of Storms
209149.description:
From publisher blurb:

One thousand years ago, the gods and titans slew one another in a great battle for the heavens. In their destruction, their blood rained from the heavens, permeating the earth, and drenching the soil. Centuries passed. From this blood arose powerful beings, capable of unearthly feats. Some were born of god’s blood, noble and perfect. Others were born from titans blood, twisted and malevolent. A third was born an abomination of the two — half god, half titan: the bloodless gorgons.

But the Storm is coming. The time of ascendancy is at hand. The kingdom can have but one ruler — the King of Storms. Which child of heaven shall take his or her place upon the throne?

And who will be consumed by the Storm?

Praxis is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters into dramatic situations and is based on the principles of the Protocol game system. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start-points, roles, plot twists, and finales. Praxis does not play like a traditional roleplaying game. It does not require a gamemaster. There is no script. No endpoint. No cumbersome or extraneous mechanics detracting from the story. An entire epic can be played in under four hours.

209150.name: Of the Flesh
209150.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Of the Flesh, the characters are tormented undead, fighting to return to normal after an infection has ruined the world. Each has suffered from a horrible disease ripping them from the living world, but not laid it to rest completely. Some undead have languished for decades, while others have returned from the grave, unsure of how much time has past.

After years of penance, these undead creatures want nothing more than to be whole again. But the world is a darker version of its old self. The streets are littered with reminders of the fight to stay alive. Boarded up windows. Checkpoints. Armed guards. People are wary of anything that isn’t right. Passing for human among skeptics and hunters isn’t easy.

But how can humanity be found in this detritus? How can something reclaim its humanity without losing all that remains?

Praxis is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters into dramatic situations and is based on the principles of the Protocol game system. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start-points, roles, plot twists, and finales. Praxis does not play like a traditional roleplaying game. It does not require a gamemaster. There is no script. No endpoint. No cumbersome or extraneous mechanics detracting from the story. An entire epic can be played in under four hours.

209151.name: The Black Monk
209151.description:
From publisher blurb:

In The Black Monk, the characters are people living in a desolate, but vibrant world where time seems to have lost meaning. Living for decades, perhaps longer, in isolation from others, the people of Elysia toil in work, only to be visited once a year by the Black Monk.

In between these visits, their lives are interrupted by sometimes trivial and other times confusing events. Everything seems to fit together like an elongated jigsaw puzzle, but no one can see the starter pieces stretching across the horizon.

But they don’t complain. There is always more work. The village needs workers.

Then one evening, the sun stayed in the sky all day. When there should have been night, the sun remained. And now it feels as though it’s been years since the Black Monk came. But perhaps it was yesterday. Nothing is right…

Is that blood?

Praxis is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters into dramatic situations and is based on the principles of the Protocol game system. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start-points, roles, plot twists, and finales. Praxis does not play like a traditional roleplaying game. It does not require a gamemaster. There is no script. No endpoint. No cumbersome or extraneous mechanics detracting from the story. An entire epic can be played in under four hours.

209152.name: Odin's Eye
209152.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Odin’s Eye, the characters are search and rescue specialists aboard a galaxy-hopping spaceship. They’re dedicated, highly-trained, and often sent into impossibly hostile places. Their motto — “No Star Unturned” — serves as a reminder to never give up, even when the mission could spell their doom.

While orbiting an alien planet, the crew of Odin’s Eye intercepts a distress beacon of unknown origin, squawking from the planet’s surface. Geological instability and fluctuating weather patterns make it difficult to pinpoint the beacon’s nexus. One thing is certain, its rhythmic signature is unlike any before.

Something down there is either alien… or confused.

It’s only a matter of time before the planet’s toxicity kills whoever is sending the signal…

Praxis is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters into dramatic situations and is based on the principles of the Protocol game system. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start-points, roles, plot twists, and finales. Praxis does not play like a traditional roleplaying game. It does not require a gamemaster. There is no script. No endpoint. No cumbersome or extraneous mechanics detracting from the story. An entire epic can be played in under four hours.

209153.name: Rifts: Character Folio
209153.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Savage Rifts® Character Folio is now available with form-fillable fields on practically every page. Inside you'll find a character sheet and multiple options to optimize your character's other information like:

a page with with Powers, Cybernetics, notes on your Iconic Framework, Power Armor,and your Heroic Path
a page with space for your character's Background and Heroic Path
a page to list your Grimoire/ Psionic/ Mega Powers
a page for Robot Armor or a Vehicle
a page for Friend and Ally stat blocks
a page for Contacts and Nemeses
a grid page for sketching out a map (old school!) or taking notes




We've also added a handy reference sheet of Combat Options!

209154.name: Cal-Balt (HERO 6)
209154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cal-Balt the Invincible hails from a timeline torn apart by terrible Chronal energies. Now Cal-Balt roams the time-stream hunting those with time-travel powers. He knows that the time-stream was devastated by someone in the past. Cal-Balt will not stop until the one who did the damage is destroyed. His amazing power-armor, combined with his own formidable powers make Cal-Balt the Invincible a true terror.

209155.name: Coils of the Medusa (Savage Worlds)
209155.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces from a parallel dimension lure our heroes into a deadly trap!

Can they discover the secrets of Lord Minus before they are torn asunder by his deadly magicks?

This superhero adventure is for use with Savage Worlds

209156.name: Coils of the Medusa (Supers!)
209156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces from a parallel dimension lure our heroes into a deadly trap!

Can they discover the secrets of Lord Minus before they are torn asunder by his deadly magicks?

This adventure is for use with SUPERS! Revised Edition

209157.name: Shades of Yggdar
209157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being pursued by a murderous war-party of grooth, the Heroes are two days into the chase. They have only slept in snatches, tasted few scraps of food, and are cold, tired, and thirsty. Always, it seems, the grooth war-party is close on their heels. Feral eyes glinting in the near-distance. The PCs are just breaking a hasty camp, when a scouting party of grooth come upon them.

Shades of Yggdar is a one session adventure for Barbarians of Lemuria: Mythic Edition.

209158.name: Mortos
209158.description:
Mortos is a FPS video game set in near future where the human race is dying after the arrival of the undead army, the hero has to fight and destroy completely all the undeads in various maps or places that are in different setting/scenarios to restore the dead city and complete the goal.

Source: The Publisher Website.

209159.name: Ghosts in the Moon Tower
209159.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heroes are traveling through the mountains of Besharoon, where they chance upon a village of peaceful herders. A mysterious archway and rumors of fantastic wealth draw them even higher into the crags, to the site of an ancient ruin.

The characters discover crypts guarded by masked mummies, but the biggest surprise
is a slender bell-tower that appears when moonlight bathes the central plaza. Inside the tower, ghosts enjoy an eternal celebration.

One ghost in particular wants the Heroes to trigger the means of his release. Depending on their actions, the characters could unwittingly free an army of shambling mummies!

Ghosts in the Moon Tower is a one session adventure for Barbarians of Lemuria: Mythic Edition.

209160.name: The Complete Adventures
209160.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven single session adventures for Barabarians of Lemuria: Mythic Edition.

Bloodhunt!

Somewhere above the canopy of scarlet and jade foliage the sun must be glaring. A line of porters, hunters, and trackers slash their way through the steaming jungle, pausing only to wipe sweat from their brows or slap at insects.

Without warning, the surrounding gloom goes deathly still. Even the incessant chatter of birds high in the zannibal trees stops. The safari members eye each other uneasily, hands straying to weapon-hilts. Then: a thunderous roar shatters the quiet.

The echoes die. Atop his kroark, broad- shouldered Lax Dhalv chuckles at the party’s reaction. “Just a bouphon – and a small one.” Still, his dissipated eyes scan the surrounding vines, and he uncoils the braided whip from over his shoulder. “Make haste. We need to reach the encampment by nightfall.”

Grumbling, the group resumes its pace through verdant hell. A dusky-skinned Shamballan tracker, long accustomed to jungle ways, shakes her head. “That was no bouphon...”

Chidren of the Void

“Under bright skies, the silted harbor of Skara-Issk glitters along her rotting wharves and ruined avenues. But the eye is drawn west, upwards, towards the massive tower that served as a lighthouse back when ships’ prows cut the waters of the bay. Come nightfall, the tower’s apex flares with a brilliant bluish-white that no hand tends, and no fuel feeds. Who can say what the lighthouse of Skara-Issk guides now . . .”

Crimson Shoals

Wind-driven rain pounds the dark outcroppings of reef, churning the nearby shoals into froth. Despite the gloom, occasional lightning flashes reveal a small forest of splintered ship’s masts, shattered keels, and barnacle-encrusted hulls. This watery hell is a ship’s graveyard!

Less than a quarter-league’s walk (or swim) looms the silhouette of a massive funerary barge. But why is this ungainly, low draught craft beached here, in the Gulf of Satarla? Doubtless, the answer lies somewhere below her dark decks...

Ghosts in the Moontower

The Heroes are traveling through the mountains of Besharoon, where they chance upon a village of peaceful herders. A mysterious archway and rumors of fantastic wealth draw them even higher into the crags, to the site of an ancient ruin.

The characters discover crypts guarded by masked mummies, but the biggest surprise is a slender bell-tower that appears when moonlight bathes the central plaza. Inside the tower, ghosts enjoy an eternal celebration.

One ghost in particular wants the Heroes to trigger the means of his release. Depending on their actions, the characters could unwittingly free an army of shambling mummies!

Shades of Yggdar

Being pursued by a murderous war-party of grooth, the Heroes are two days into the chase. They have only slept in snatches, tasted few scraps of food, and are cold, tired, and thirsty. Always, it seems, the grooth war-party is close on their heels. Feral eyes glinting in the near-distance. The PCs are just breaking a hasty camp, when a scouting party of grooth come upon them.

The Skyward Citadel

Travel-stained and weary the heroes arrive before the gates of the bustling city. However the usual routine of the metropolis has been shattered by the arrival of a floating castle, hovering like a storm cloud over the palace. At night, “winged demons” swoop down from caves located on the underside of the castle and snatch unwary nobles away for ransom.

The Unholy Greyl

Greyl wood - precious, rare and prized by the nobility of Satarla. The catch? Greyl grows only in a coastal forest near the Festrel Swamp, haunted by nocturnal horrors.

Working with the merchant captain Saval Krael, will your dreams of wealth be realised?

209161.name: Evening Session Map Set #17
209161.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need an encounter map on the fly?

Have Your players turned left instead right (again!)?

Do You want to run a quick game for your friends in the evening and looking for inspiration?

If you answered yes for one (or more) of these questions, The Forge Studios has released a product that suits your needs.

Evening Session Map provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Evening Session Map #17' consists of maps and handouts of old prison for magic users.

The set consists of:

a perspective drawing of the prison;
four levels of the prison

209162.name: Sowthistle Farm
209162.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whilst the Lords rule and the knights fight, all across the kingdom, hundreds of farmers work hard, producing crops to feed a nation. Sowthistle Farm is one of those farms, with a farmhouse, barn and a few fields.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a medieval farm. The farmhouse is simply furnished, with a raised sleeping area. Across the farmyard is a barn and storeroom, standing beside a simple roofed animal pen. A country lane separates the farm from the fields of crops, some of which have already been harvested,

209163.name: Baumland
209163.description:
Baumland, a.k.a. Bauland, is a communication and negotiation game in which the parties involved — industry, agriculture, construction, ecology, and politics — all try to nab the most valuable sites for themselves. The first four parties try to grab the best ground, with certain locations having different values for certain parties, while the politicians try to win together with one party (without being too obvious about it in order to avoid new elections).

Different versions of the game make play more complicated through the introduction of secret collaborations. Be as honest or as mean as you like — it's up to you...

209164.name: Jets Erweiterung
209164.description: Jets Erweiterung consists of six 3D jet figures for use with the Jets board game as well as a large game board.

209165.name: Migrant Stories: Playtest
209165.description:
(publisher blurb)

This is a playtest ruleset for the roleplaying game Migrant Stories, based on the Apocalypse World engine.

Migrant Stories is a creative tool for telling a realistic, collaborative story from the perspective of people of color and minorities. There are no dragons or wizards in Migrant Stories, but there’s plenty of mystery, dirty wonder and intrigue. You’ll tell the story of newly or not-so-newly arrived immigrants in a curious, Western, Industrial civilization, probably around the turn of the twentieth century, and explore the obstacles they face in pursuit of glory, profit or redemption.

Those obstacles will most likely come in the form of isolation, bigotry and hatemongering. In telling their stories, how your characters confront those issues will make all the difference. Your characters may work together to confront the forces of bigotry and ostracization, but oftentimes they will find themselves pitted against one another as they work to achieve their own goals. No story would be complete without those complications.

Migrant Stories strives to tell the emotional truth, if not the historical truth, of the immigrant experience. The characters are tough, noble, complicated, hardheaded and fanciful in the face of ignorance and hostility. It’s their truth, but it is everyone else’s truth, too.

209166.description:
Description from the publisher:

Following the call of the gods, the players settle at the base of mountain Meduris. Building huts, bringing offerings to the druid, gathering precious runestones, and building monumental temples is the only way to earn the favor of the gods in Meduris.

1. Skillful use of the workers lets you obtain valuable materials. These are needed to build huts and temples.

2. The larger the settlement,the more expensive it is to build a hut there. But if you can get in the good graces of the druid by presenting an offering, then your effort pays off.

3. Keep an eye on the other players: Who will secure the best building sites at the right time, and collect the most valuable rune stones?

4. Only a player who skillfully places their huts and temples, and keeps enough materials ready for the big final round of offerings, will win the game.

Game description from the publisher:
Dem Ruf der Götter folgend, machen sich die Spieler auf, um den Fuß des Berges Méduris zu besiedeln. Hütten bauen, dem Druiden Opfergaben darbringen, wertvolle Runensteine sammeln und monumentale Tempel errichten – nur so können die Spieler die Gunst der Götter gewinnen.
209166.name: Meduris: Der Ruf der Götter
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 11: Stilte voor de Storm
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016
The Game Pit: Episode 74 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 4
Vox Republica 135: Gaming Difficulty

209167.name: Big Game Night 2016
209167.description:
Description from the bottom of the box:

AEG's Big Game Night has been a hit event at Gen Con Indy for the last three years. Now you can also have all of the same excitement without buying a plane ticket! Enjoy these great AEG games, available only in this box, this year. In this box you will find 4 games from acclaimed designer Seiji Kanai (Love Letter, Lost Legacy, Cheaty Mages):

1 copy of Love Letter -- Kanai Edition with oversized cards
1 copy of Say Adios to the Villains
1 copy of Eight Epics -- Kanai Edition
1 copy of Regality and Religion -- Kanai Edition




You will also find:

2 boxes fitted to contain up to 7 games from AEG's pocket line!
3 empty pocket line boxes to store gaming components such as dice, tokens or even other games!

209168.name: Get Reelz
209168.description:
Get Reelz is a movie-themed party game where each round one player (the Producer) decides which movie is going to be made! The other players represent Writers that must scramble to come up with the most entertaining movie title that also fits the demands of the studio.

Writers accomplish this by flipping, rotating, mixing, and matching the movie title cards in their hands. Each side has a word or phrase that can be added to their movie's title.

When time runs out, everyone pitches their title to the Producer. Get the most movies made to win!

Hollywood is running out of ideas!

209169.name: UFC: Tapout
209169.description:
UFC: Tapout is a video game in the fighting genre based upon the Ultimate Fighting Championship. The game was released in North America on February 28, 2002 for the Xbox console.

Tapout was published by Crave Entertainment and developed by DreamFactory. The subtitle Tapout refers to a fighter tapping his hand indicating that he has submitted to a submission hold. A tapout, along with a knockout, judge's decision, and referee stoppage, is one of the ways of ending a UFC bout.

The game features many of UFC's top stars including Matt Hughes, Chuck Liddell, Mark Coleman, Frank Shamrock, and Tito Ortiz. Competitions can take place in several modes such as exhibition, tournament, arcade, and championship mode. Several fighters throughout the game are unlockable such as two female competitors and celebrity Ice-T.

UFC: Tapout received generally lukewarm reviews from critics. A sequel to this game entitled UFC: Tapout 2 was released in 2003. Other than an updated roster, the game is very similar to the first Tapout and received similar reviews. Tapout 2 was published by TDK Mediactive. Both games have an ESRB rating of T for Teen.
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC:_Tapout," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

209170.name: Kane & Lynch Collection
209170.description:
User Summary

Both Kane & Lynch games in one box.

209171.name: Are You Mental?
209171.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter:

A totally unique, customized for craziness system that I probably should come up with a catchy name for. Here is how it works:

Risk and uncertainty (the hallmark of great games everywhere) are emulated by a dice and card mechanic. Sure we could just say, "Do whatever you want!" but that is not really a game. It is a substitute teacher saddled with an over-sugared kindergarten (surprisingly similar to our convention sessions...)

When a player wants to use a superpower or do something that could fail horribly, they draw a challenge card and attempt to do what the card commands.

This might be to roll doubles on your dice, or to quickly eat something you find on the table, or to compose a short poem about your desired results.

User summary:

Product is intended to include a rules booklet and (printable) cards.

209173.description:
Mare Nostrum: Resource Chips / Jetons de poker are poker chips that can replace the cardboard resource tokens included in Mare Nostrum: Empires.

Contents:

Inventory sheet (language-neutral)
Tray and poker chips (the quantities marked "+n" are to accommodate the Atlas expansion)
Ceramic (3+2)
Gems (5)
Papyrus (5)
Metal (5+2)
Spices (5)
Stone (5)
Wood (5)
Gold (7+2)
Grain (9+2)
Oil (9+2)
Sheep (9+2)
Wine (9+2)
Gladiator (11)
Coin (44+6)
13 Legendary Commodities (1 of each type)





This box includes 164 Resource Chips (diameter: 39 mm) replacing the Resource tokens of Mare Nostrum - Empires and its expansion: Atlas, as well as a plastic sorting tray and a notice to sort the Chips.
209173.name: Mare Nostrum: Resource Chips

209174.name: Sictitious: A Novel Word Game
209174.description: [sic]titious is a party game for adults who love word play. In the game of [sic]titious, you define just how clever or crass you want to be. We’ve loaded the deck with more than 100 humorous altered words. Just flip a card, flip the timer and come up with a definition. Players award their [sic], [sic]er and [sic]est point cards for what they think are the best (or funniest) definitions. Or, the card flipper can be judge and jury and award the word card in play for their favorite definition.

209175.name: Princesses & Unicorns
209175.description: In Princesses & Unicorns, players use their identical decks to bid on three types of prizes — crowns, gowns and frogs — because a princess needs as many of these to pick from as possible. The Fairy Godmother will let you choose a prize whereas the witch will cost you a point...

209176.name: Sheepdogs
209176.description: Sheepdogs is a trick-taking game in which the sheepdogs are trump and four types of sheep are the different suits. Players bid to predict the number of tricks they will take and must be exactly right to gain any points. However, the player who collects the most black sheep always gets a point. Mind the wolf and the penned sheep as these cards can derail the best made plans.

209177.name: Bavarian Holiday
209177.description:
What can be better than drinking beer at a fine pub and enjoying the scenic mountain views?

In the dice game Bavarian Holiday, players choose how many and which color of dice to roll to represent which types of beer they have ordered. If you run out of beer spaces to cross off your core sheet, you spill your beer and are forced to roll only for pretzels. Be the first one to quit before spilling too many beers or eating too many pretzels, and you get bonus points for having the good sense to leave the pub, buy flowers, and go home. 15-20 minutes 2-5 players

209178.name: Midnight Legion Box Set
209178.description:
(publisher blurb)

You are an android agent who had been activated after hundreds of years of stasis. Your scheduled mission is still centuries in the future, but your underground base has been invaded and you are needed to defend it.

Unfortunately, it will take time for your memories to return. As you fight, trick or sneak your way up from the lower levels to the surface and your memories begin filtering back, you realize that your mission is not what you thought it was—and you may not be who you think you are.

Choose your strategy wisely, because every choice you make now will lead to different options later. The world has changed since you were put to sleep, and you will need to decide whether you are still willing to follow your ancient orders or whether you are ready to set a new future in motion.

(user addition)

Contains Gamebook 1, rules, map and dice.

209180.name: Banco Cartella de Colombie Internationale
209180.description:
User summary:

An unusual adventure that presents a bank the adventuring party is intended to rob. The locale and relevant non-player characters are detailed. The method of robbery will depend upon the plan the characters determine.

For 8th level characters.

This adventure typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing the HTML scenario and image files to support the page.

209181.name: Belthar's Bane
209181.description:
User summary:

The party stops from their travels in a small town and takes a room in a local inn. In the evening they are eating in the tavern room when they overhear some of the patrons talking about an old tale of adventure and magic.

An introductory scenario for 1st level characters. Note the scenario was distributed as ASCII only; instructions were included to send away for player handouts and a map.

209182.name: Galaxy Reavers
209182.description:
This is a fun yet challenging RTS game. In order to survive in the enormous galaxy, players have to build up their own fleet and have every warship well equipped. And to control your warships in every battle, defeating your enemies, conquering different planets and thus expanding your territory!

Source: The Game Website.

209183.name: VHSoverdose
209183.description:
User Summary

VHSoverdose is an action game.

209184.name: ShowdownVR
209184.description:
User Summary

Test yourself in atmospheric battle arena by dodging attacks, scoring, earning action points with combos and using them to ultimately crush your foes with counter attacks.

209185.name: Pixel-Warfare: Pro
209185.description:
User Summary

Pixel-Warfare: Pro is a first person shooter game.

209186.name: I Survived New York!
209186.description:
This is a card game based on the stress of living in the Big Apple. There is a deck of 98 cards. Of these, 19 are I Survived New York! cards, which when played in front of a player, open that player to getting stressed out. There are 34 Stress Cards, of five types: Romance, Bucks, Shelter, Nine to Five, and Why Me? There are 38 Relief cards, each of which stops a specific type of stress. There are 5 Quick Fix cards, one for each kind of stress, that both provide relief and prevent that player from receiving any more stress of that kind for the rest of the round. Finally, there are 2 Reversal cards, which of course allow a player to dump his current stress on another player.

Players receive 5 cards each to start, and each turn draw one card and either play or discard one card. They may play their cards on any player including themselves. An I Survived New York card opens a player to receiving stress, one card at a time. A Relief card "closes" a stress pile, at which point that player then adds up his accumulated stress cards and notes the total on a scorepad. All the cards in the closed pile go into the discard pile, and that player is now free of additional stress until someone opens a new stress pile with an ILNY card.

As soon as one player has reached 4,000 stress points and closed his current pile, the round ends, and all cards are returned and reshuffled. When a player accumulates more than 12,000 stress points, he burns out totally and must move to Cleveland. The last survivor wins the game, unless a player accumulates exactly 12,000 points, at which point he wins instantly and becomes Mayor of New York.

209187.name: Kings under the hill
209187.description:
User Summary

Kings under the hill is a side-scrolling real time strategy.

209188.name: Zenith (2016)
209188.description:
Zenith is an action RPG coated in humor. Adventuring! Exploring ruins! Saving the world! You know the drill. A single player game with an actual story. No oneiric or do-it-yourself crap. You won't need to piece the story together by yourself as if it was a swedish chair. We promise.

Source: The Game Website.

209189.name: The Hot Dog Race
209189.description:
This Depression-era game involves manipulating a string to move cardboard dogs. There is a sheet of very thick cardboard that is folded into a three-dimensional row of four kennels with a starting ledge in front of them. A thick cardboard dog is attached to each kennel by a string.

Players stand in a line equally distant from the kennels and with strings of equal length. They line up the dogs by leaning them on the edge of the starting ledge, and then wiggle or shake their strings so that their dogs move toward them across the playing table. First dog across the finish line wins. Any player touching a dog is disqualified.

209190.name: Coin Quest
209190.description: In the secret auction bidding game Coin Quest, players are coin collectors attempting to amass the most valuable coin collection.

209191.name: The Uncertain - Episode 1: The Last Quiet Day
209191.description:
The Uncertain is an episodic story-driven adventure game set in a post-apocalyptic world. Experience the mysterious vibe of each of carefully explored locations, solve diverse puzzles, make fateful decisions and discuss intriguing matters to find out the whole truth being kept from you.

Source: The Game Website.

209192.name: The Secret Order 4: Beyond Time
209192.description:
Escape from a time trap!

Source: The Publisher Website.

209193.name: Angels & Demigods
209193.description:
VR capable sci-fi visual novel which takes place in the distant future on Enceladus.

Source: The Developer Website.

209194.name: Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 3DS Game Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Hero of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
209194.description:
Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse takes place in the 2030s, within the same setting as Shin Megami Tensei IV. Twenty-five years prior, a devastating war was waged between the angels and the armies of Lucifer. To protect Tokyo from damage, a great rock dome was created. While it protected Tokyo, resources became progressively scarcer over the following years, while angels and demons ruled over the human population.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Megami_Tensei_IV%3A_Apocalypse Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

209195.name: Tracks of Triumph: Summertime
209195.description:
User Summary

Sequel to a Tracks of Triumph: Industrial Zone with 25 new levels and new environments. Features more balanced weapons, enemies and maps.

209196.name: Sig.Null
209196.description:
This is a remake and expansion of an earlier PuzzleScript game, Signal. What I thought was so brilliant about the original is that while the rules never change, the level design is such that your ability to fully comprehend and exploit those rules shifts radically...

Source: The Publisher Website.

209197.name: Cossacks 3
209197.description:
Cossacks 3 is a rare combination of war, economy, army developing, building and upgrading that couldn’t be found in any game for the last 15 years.

Source: The Game Website.

209198.name: Beyond the Grave
209198.description:
From the introduction:

The dying Duke woke from his afternoon nap, screaming "Poisoned, I've been poisoned!" "That of a son in law couldn't wait for an old man to die quietly, impatient sod..." When a guard appears, the guard is told to fetch the Priest, "Pretty dam quick". The growing crowd in the bedroom is dismissed when the Preist arrives. From his deathbed the Old Duke forces the Priest to Promise that he will Reanimate his dead body and use it to wreck vengeance on his poisoner. As the Priest agrees the Old Duke vomits on the bed and dies.

User summary:

This atypical adventure incorporates elements of traditional murder mysteries. It is suitable for 1st level characters. The scenario is distributed as an HTML page and supporting image files (maps).

209199.name: Book of Shadows
209199.description:
User summary:

Book of Shadows presented several dozen magical spells that all dealt with shadows or shadow-themes in some way. The spells are notable for including several at the high-end of the spell power spectrum (e.g., many 9th level spells). Additionally, many of the spells deal with necromancy.

209201.name: The NetBook of Books
209201.description:
From the introduction:

This is a list of various roleplaying relating books compiled from the AD&D List Server.

User summary:

Enumerates various books by title. About one third of the books feature a description - some of these are magical books. Many books - especially mundane books - are given only as a title. Although the work was designed specifically for AD&D, it is generic enough to be used in any fantasy-themed milieu.

209202.name: Chuco
209202.description:
This is an asymmetrical abstract game of movement. The game board is a grid of squares six deep by four wide, with the four squares in the upper left excluded and replaced by the game label. The result is two columns of four squares and two of six squares, with stars at each corner numbered from 1 to 31.

The stars are connected by pathways orthogonally and along alternating diagonals, so a given star may have as few as three connections on an edge and eight in the middle of the board.

One player takes the Chuco, a single large black plastic figure, and the other player takes 12 smaller blue hunters. Pieces may move one space along any path to an empty star, but the Chuco can jump an adjacent hunter if there is an open space behind it.

The Chuco moves first, starting on star #13, third rank in the middle. The hunters start across the first two ranks and on the two edge stars on the third rank. The hunters win if they can immobilize the Chuco by surrounding it on star 27. Since doing so requires all 12 hunters, the Chuco player wins by jumping a single hunter.

209203.name: The Catacombs of Farthis
209203.description:
From the introduction:

You have ventured through the heart of the Groslen woods to discover that the rumored village of Farthis is indeed a reality. Upon discovering a drop chute that leads into the darkness after slaying what seemed to be the guardian to what lies below, you now stand before the menacing hole in the earth. You kick a rock into the chute only to hear a faint “tink” about 25 seconds later. You estimate the hole to be about 200’ deep. The rungs on the chute seem sturdy.

User summary:

For 2nd - 5th level characters. The scenario typically was distributed with a GIF file (map).

209205.name: The Farthis Village
209205.description:
From the introduction:

There have been many rumors about a small, self sufficient village named Farthis that contain wealth beyond the imagination of any commoner. Some rumor the village to harbor a cult-like populace that will stop at anything to protect the riches that supposedly lie in a vault underneath the town. Some rumor that the villagers know nothing of the treasure at all, but a powerful mage fled to Farthis to keep his treasures hidden and safe.

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters. The scenario typically is distributed with a GIF file (map).

209206.name: Hypergrid
209206.description:
Hypergrid is the ultimate action-driven abstract game of sandbox tactics for two players from 7 y.o., takes ca 16 turns per player to play.
Place 2 tokens on a turn, combo their effects, create more lines than your opponent, rule the GRID!
Three principles only to follow and five special effects to master… more complex game of tic-tac-toe with less rules than game of chess that puts two in a battle of wits with no luck involved and opens more than three dimensions to explore endlessly! ... a smaller 3x3 grid of colorful stacks makes HYPERGRID a challenge like no other.

Players gain points for each newly created line of three chips of the same elements (colors) on a 3x3 grid. Each player starts with six chips in each of the five elements, and on each turn a player places exactly two tokens. When an element is placed on at least two chips underneath, the player can use its elemental effect. When a player can no longer place a chip, the player with the most points wins.

COMPONENTS : Play-mat, 65 chips (13 pcs in 5 colours), 9+2 6-sided dice, 2 quick reference cards, user’s guide.

209207.name: Cathedral of the Dead
209207.description:
From the introduction:

[The player characters attempt] to recover the scroll of destruction and amulet of reversal, in order to resurrect a dead PC. The cathedral is a [actually] temple of Bardos, a minor demon from the Abyss. The priests are starting to form a small, undead army to seize control of the surrounding region. They do not want to draw attention to themselves, and are masking their activities behind the veil of a normal, good-aligned cathedral.

User summary:

A brief scenario for 3rd - 5th level characters. N.B. The scenario is distributed in the rather odd Postscript format (not PDF) that must be rendered into a displayable format by an appropriate tool. It includes several maps.

209208.name: The Cauldron of Bhon
209208.description:
From the introduction:

In the time when the Drows and Elfs of Ultifar battled, a Drow cleric decided to change the flow of the war [in favor of his] people...

He made a special favor to the God of Beasts (Bhon). In exchange for that favor, Bhon created the Father of Dragons, Vanussolar. Although Vanussolar was a colossal red dragon, he lacked intelligence. So Asmodeus, the goddess of evil, touched Bhon´s creation, and it became complete...

User summary:

The scenario presents a series of thematically connected adventure locales. The difficult is fairly uneven but probably suitable for mid-level characters. The scenario typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing the RTF scenario, two GIF files (maps), and eight BMP files (player handouts).

209209.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Siege of the Citadel: Brotherhood Expansion adds the Brotherhood faction to the game including a sixth player board (and rules to expand the game to six players) with Nikodemus and Crenshaw as your heroes.
209209.name: Siege of the Citadel: Brotherhood Expansion

209210.name: Battlerite
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Nominee
209210.description:
Experience the unique combination of a top-down shooter with a fast-paced fighting game.

Source: The Game Website.

209211.name: Ballistic Tanks
209211.description:
Ballistic Tanks is the best tank game you've played since the 80's. It is an intense arcade shooter where you destroy tanks in a frenzy of bullets, lasers, and explosions!

Source: The Game Website.

209212.name: Diorama Battle of NINJA
209212.description:
A ninja survival game where you wage combat in an expansive diorama landscape.

Source: The Publisher Website.

209213.name: Wheels of Aurelia
videogamehonor: 2017 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Honorable Mention
209213.description:
A narrative road trip game set in the roaring Italian 70s, it tells the story of Lella, a restless woman driving on the roads of the western coast of Italy, the famous “Via Aurelia”.

Source: The Game Website.

209214.name: The Caves of Torment
209214.description:
From the introduction:

You are resting in the small farming village of Homestead on your journey seeking adventure and fortune.

While you are in the only inn in town you notice that all of the townsfolk seem to be run down, depressed and sickly.

After a while you are approached by a shabby old man who says he in the mayor of this blighted place.

User summary:

For low-level characters. Distributed as an ASCII file with two BMP files (maps).

209215.name: Celtic Druids and the Tuatha de Dannan
209215.description:
From the introduction:

Celts are often a source of inspiration for gamers, in their heroic-fantasy campaigns. And in fact, the bard and druid classes owe primarily to the Celtic lore, before having become archetypes of role-playing games.

[T]his D20 supplement delves into the Celtic mythology, to describe a pantheon and religion with a strong Celtic flair. As such, this netbook owes more to movies and comics than actual history. All the content of this document is intended for game purpose only, and has no historical / literacy value otherwise.

209217.name: WCW Nitro Trading Card Game: Hardcore Expansion
209217.description:
This expansion adds 114 cards to the original game, including 8 new wrestlers:

"Big Poppa Pump" Scott Steiner
Brian Knobbs
Hollywood Hogan
Norman Smiley
Ric Flair
Tank Abbott
Terry Funk
Vampiro

The focus of this set was allowing players to take the action outside the ring and perform special moves that could only be used on the arena floor.

Game description from the back of the Slap Pack booster box:
Get in the Ring! The high-flying action of the WCW Nitro trading card game spills out of the ring and into your hands with the Hardcore expansion set! Grab that folding chair and jump into the melee with the newest hardcore Wrestler cards. Create crushing decks with all-stars Funk and Vampiro or ring monsters like Tank Abbott and Big Poppa Pump. Collect them all and watch your opponent beg for mercy.

209218.name: The Charnel God
209218.description:
From the introduction:

A priestess of Thasmudyan, the lord of the undead, has ordered the abduction of a young girl to use in a horrible experiment involving the undead. The priestess has a temple hidden under the town morgue. The morgue serves as a funeral parlor, and they handle the burials of the local town. The cult includes some villagers. These followers have joined for their own selfish reasons. The cult acts subtly, secretly stealing the bodies of those who they are supposed to bury to feed their charnel god.

User summary:

A brief scenario for 1st - 3rd level characters. There will be zombies.

209219.name: The Chillwater Treaty
209219.description:
From the introduction:

[Thirty] years ago gold was discovered in the mountains that border the duchy of Westmoreland. As such discoveries always do, the news of gold and the promise of quick wealth drew hoards of prospectors and miners to the remote area hoping to make their fortune. Several conditions made this activity quite dangerous, however. For one, the location of the gold deposits were up in the high peaks region of the mountain range where the weather was cold and the terrain was treacherous and unforgiving. Many who went in search of riches fell victim to the harsh elements and never returned. Compounding the problem was the fact that a deep canyon carved through the mountains by the Chillwater river lay between the gold field and the nearest town. Crossing the canyon was practically impossible, and circumventing the hazard added weeks to the travel time.

User summary:

For 6th - 9th level characters. The scenario typically is distributed as an RPT scenario file and three JPG files (maps).

209220.description:
Lady Richmond - Fast fight for inheritance! is a fast auction game in which players bid for the inheritance of Lady Richmond. Bid, cheat, and acquire the most valuable pieces to win the game.

English publisher's text:
... There's excitement at the Wetherby auction house. After the unexpected passing of wealthy Lady Richmond, her estate is being auctioned off. The player who keeps an overview of the auction chaos and uses their money carefully will manage to secure the best items and win the turbulent game.
Bid, cheat, and grab the inheritance ... Lady Richmond offers excitement to the very end!

1. The game board slowly fills up with valuable heirlooms – but also with worthless junk.

2. Be quick: Grab the auction block at the right moment and make the first bid.

3. But bidding is not everything: Use the cheat tiles and irritate the other players!

German publisher's text:
... Hochspannung im Auktionshaus Wetherby. Nachdem die reiche Lady Richmond unerwartet dahingeschieden ist, wird nun der Nachlass versteigert. Wer im Getümmel der Auktion die Übersicht behält und sein Geld mit Bedacht einsetzt, schafft es am Ende, sich die besten Stücke zu sichern und die turbulente Zockerei zu gewinnen.
Ein rasantes Versteigerungsspiel.
Hochspannung bis zum Schluss!
209220.name: Lady Richmond: Ein erzocktes Erbe
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016

209221.description:
Adventure Land: King & Princess features three new scenarios, as well as new components, for Adventure Land that bring even more variety into play. There are various challenges awaiting heroic adventurers: The princess has been kidnapped, the super fog creatures are attacking the capital city, and the king needs to be protected. The three new and very different scenarios make it continually varied and always exciting.

1. Kidnap of the princess
Who will be the first to collect all the keys and have enough combat strength to rescue the princess?

2. Uprising of the fog creatures
The players fight together against the super fog creatures in order to survive this cooperative adventure.

3. Rescue of the king
The full game board entices you with herbs, swords, and companions. Who can protect the king and collect the most of each item?
209221.name: Adventure Land: King & Princess

209222.description:
Dragon Tower is a cooperative memory and dexterity game in which players must rescue the captured princess from the dragon's tower.

English publisher's text:

A fearsome dragon has trapped the princess in his tower. The prince and his companions rush to her aid. They must skillfully work together using their strong memory skills in order to rescue the princess before the dragon makes everything come crashing down.

German publisher's text:

Der furchterregende Drache hat die Prinzessin in seinen Turm gesperrt. Sofort eilen der Prinz und seine Gefährten zu Hilfe. Nur mit einem guten Gedächtnis und viel Geschick schaffen es die Spieler gemeinsam, die Prinzessin zu retten, bevor der Drache alles zum Einsturz bringt.

Ein kooperatives Memo- und Geschicklichkeitsspiel.
• cooler Effekt: der Drache zieht an der Schnur und das Gerüst stürzt ein
• Drache funktioniert ohne Batterie
• spektakulärer 3-D-Aufbau
209222.name: Drachenturm
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 76 - Picking Over the Bones Family Edition

209223.name: Meine große Obstgarten Spielesammlung
209223.description:
Meine große Obstgarten Spielesammlung is a gigantic game compilation of memory, card, tactile and dice games that includes both the original Obstgarden game and nine other games in the same box.

German publishers info:
Riesige Spielesammlung rund um den Obstgarten
• 10 in 1: original Obstgarten-Spiel UND 9 weitere, abwechslungsreiche Spielideen in einer Packung
• mit Memo-, Karten-, Fühl- und Würfelspielen
• umfangreiches, hochwertiges Spielmaterial aus Holz und Pappe

209224.name: Strategonon
209224.description:
Miniatures wargame played on a square grid, attempting to be more realistic and less chess-like than older similar efforts, without the complexity of map-based free movement wargames. Infantry and cavalry are represented by tiny painted metal figures placed in holes drilled in wooden tiles. Figures are removed to show losses from combat, although the exact number of soldiers remaining in each unit is tracked using pencil and paper. Artillery and various supply and naval units are represented by metal or cardboard figures.

Wooden blocks are placed on the board to show heights, and players can optionally build cardboard terrain following illustrations in the rulebook to place on the board instead of just using colored cardboard tiles to represent different terrain types. The cardboard terrain is flat and placed standing along the edges of map squares so that units can still be placed in the squares.

209225.description:
Vikingjarl is a fun and exciting strategy game about Vikings and Norse Mythology. As a player, you start of as one of four Jarls, and the goal is to sail, trade and plunder your way to the title of “King of Kaupang”. The game is designed for 2-4 players, and is suitable for everybody form age 12 and up. An average round will take about 60 minutes. Includeds over 260 playing cards and pieces.

The players moves viking ships and armies around the game board to do pillage, trade, settle and combat. Battles are fought with viking pawns and dice. You also have Saga-cards that depict several of the mightiest gods, heroes and relics from Norse Mythology. Collecting the right ones can dramatically alter your fortune during your endeavours in the game. Players are fighting a battle among themselves on the game board, and must make strategic choices and manage their resources in the best possible way. The game is won by victory points and whoever chooses the smartest strategy has the best chance to win.
209225.name: Vikingjarl

209226.name: Paul and the Moon
209226.description:
Description from the publisher:

Oh dear! The moon has lost his radiant magic staff! Without the mystical staff the moon cannot wax, it can only wane. But if the sparkle sprites can build a ladder along the stars before the moon vanishes behind the cloud, Paul may be able to climb up the ladder, returning the magic staff to his friend, the moon. Who would like to help Paul and the sparkle sprites? A cooperative memory game that also includes a competitive version.

Description from the publisher (German):
Oje, der Mond hat seinen leuchtenden Zauberstab verloren.
Ohne ihn kann er nicht mehr zum Vollmond werden, sondern nimmt immer weiter ab. Doch wenn die Funkelfeen an den Sternen entlang eine Leiter Richtung Mond bauen, bevor er hinter der Wolke verschwunden ist, kann Paul an ihr hochklettern und dem Mond seinen leuchtenden Zauberstab zurückgeben. Wer möchte Paul und den Funkelfeen helfen?
Ein kooperatives Memo-Spiel mit Wettbewerbsvariante.

toller 3-D-Spielaufbau mit abnehmendem Mond
in 3 Schwierigkeitsstufen
plus Gute-Nacht-Geschichte zum Vorlesen

209227.name: A la Conquista del Reino Cobra
209227.description:
